channel.title: ::gfx and ::emote?
channel.description:
Hey, I was wondering if anyone could tell me what the command is for ::gfx and ::emote; so i can test out emotes/gfx before i add them to things. A LOT easier than entering a random number, compiling, and checking if it looks good.
Thanks :D

item.title: ::gfx and ::emote?
item.dc:creator: @Dan1337 Dan1337
item.description:
@Dan1337 wrote:

Tyvm
Im working on making specs for the god swords from silabs client, and a few other things.
So this helps a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: ::gfx and ::emote?
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

if (command.startsWith("gfx")) { for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { if(p != null) { client c = (client)p; if(c.playerName != null || c.playerName != "null") { if(c.distanceToPoint(absX, absY) <= 20) { int id = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4)); outStream.createFrame(85); outStream.writeByteC(absY - (mapRegionY * 8)); outStream.writeByteC(absX - (mapRegionX * 8)); outStream.createFrame(4); outStream.writeByte(0); outStream.writeWord(id); outStream.writeByte(0); outStream.writeWord(0); } } } } } if (command.startsWith("emote") && playerRights >= 1) { try { int emote = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); if (emote < 3217 && emote > 0) { startAnimation(emote); } else { sendMessage("Bad emote ID"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Bad emote ID"); } }

Enjoy

Read full topic
